lexUnit.name: vary.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: modify or change (something) to make it less uniform.

sentence.text: The advent of thermal cyclers , which automatically vary temperature at preset times , has obviated this onerous task .
This does not mean that , as a survival technique , individual species can not vary their body size to suit circumstances .
Last year he sufferred badly from diarrhoea , the Lyons tried to vary his diet but his condition got worse .
Dr Miller is a protean leopard ; he can vary his spots .
That could be further varied by including MPs as a section of the electoral college .
From this , it is clear that the output voltage can be varied by altering the duty cycle .
These two values can usually be varied by controls mounted on the gyro itself or , in some cases , also changed at the transmitter .

He varied this routine by pushing rubbish through the letter box , pulling the flowers from the tiny strip of garden we tried to cultivate between the flagstones and chalking rude messages on my car .
By contrast , the solid fuel merchant can afford to vary the content of what goes into pre-packed bags of household fuel , provided the weight is correct .
The project will examine picture naming times under conditions which vary the relations between consecutive pictures ( changing size , orientation etc ) .
Vary the programme with humour , audio-visual devices , music , movement , colour , question and answer sessions , guest appearances .
